project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The GreenHopper Rapid Board Wallboard Gadget doesn't considering Gadget width when displaying column. Hence the Rapid board show in the gadget is "cut off" when condition below has been met:

* [Dashboard Layout|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Customising+the+Dashboard#CustomisingtheDashboard-ChoosingaDashboardLayout] is more than one Column. 

The problem is very obvious when you have more than 3 column in Rapid board. Please refer to Screnshots below:

Dashboard Layout - Single Column (/):
!Layout - single column.JPG|thumbnail!

DashBoard Layout - 2 column, 1:1 ratio (x):
!Layout - 2 columns.JPG|thumbnail!

Dashboard Layout - 2 Columns, 1:2 ratio (x):
!Layout - 2 columns 1_2 ratio.JPG|thumbnail!


*Causes:*
* Same situation happened to Wallboard plugin too. 

*Workaround:*
* None, Avoid using more than 1 column in Dashboard layout. 
* For wallboard plugin, use single column layout and setup wallboard slideshow to show more than one gadgets.
fields.summary: GreenHopper Rapid Board Wallboard Gadget doesn't shows all column

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: Unable to select scrum template even though issue type scheme correct

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When opening the agile menu, the shortcuts for the planning and the task board are missing.

Steps to reproduce:

* Open Agile menu
* Hover over the menu entry for some seconds, until the title with the shortcut is displayed
* [BUG] no shortcut is displayed for the planning and the task board
fields.summary: Agile menu is missing shortcuts

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: Let's add the ability to have a JIRA url with the additional parameter of theme so one can have a url including &theme="my theme" to return a list of the issues is the epic/theme tag.
fields.summary: Return list of issues in epic/theme from web service

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When the user is on the getting started page and clicks the "Create a new rapid board" on the kaban tab it takes about 15 seconds to display the popup.

2012-03-07 11:11:29,665 http-80-5 WARN micah 671x28377x1 czhhp 10.6.240.154 /rest/greenhopper/1.0/rapidview/createmodel [jira.requeststats.filter.ThreadStatsFilter] TIME: 14545 CPU: 8400 8060 HEAP: 457843512

Full details on SAC: https://support.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-4116
fields.summary: Performance: Improve load time of the filter list when creating a new board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: Customer wants a dashboard plugin for a pie chart to compare completed to pending story points for a defined user.
fields.summary: Customer request for Pie Chart showing Story Points pending/complete

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
According to the agile method, bugs take priority.  But in order to place them at the top of the Task Board, we need to create a Bugs story and make sure it's priority is at the top.

It would be nice if a preference would allow the "Other Issues" section to be placed higher than all stories.  Thus making bugs (or stories without sub-tasks - easily indicating needed work) higher priority.
fields.summary: Allow moving of "Other Issues" section to top of Task Board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: The JIRA Agile Global Rank field needs to have "Global Context", so it shouldn't be possible to change the context of this custom field to anything other than "Global Context".
fields.summary: It shouldn't be possible to set the context for the JIRA Agile Global Rank field

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
# Have at least one issue in Plan mode which is assigned to you
# Enable "only my issues" quick filter
# Use the 'A' shortcut to open the Assign dialog
# Unassign the issue (or assign to someone else)

The issue disappears from the backlog, but it remains in the detail view.
fields.summary: Enabling a quick filter in Plan mode which hides the current issue will keep the issue detail view open

fields.summary: Workflows with global transition break drag and drop of cards

fields.summary: GH Custom field causes NPE when converting subtask to issue on JAC

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Playing a naive first user, I'm creating a new rapid view using the Kanban presets and select one or a couple of projects. Now, my selection gives me tens of thousands of issues, since the projects are rather large. I only find that out once my browser died trying to display the rapid board.

It would be nice to be warned on the standard preset dialog if the query I'm creating returns too many issues.
fields.summary: As a first user, I'd like to be warned about too many issues when creating a rapid view

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: We definitely should not resolve the issue if there is an invalid fix version. Currently, an error is generated by the field, but the resolve still completes. The user should at least have the chance to change the fix version.
fields.summary: Can resolve an issue with an invalid fix version, no fix version saved

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Server*. Using *JIRA Software Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-4780].
  {panel}

"Release" function in Rapid Boards not working as expected:
It appears there's a problem in applying the sub-filter defined for "Work" view, resulting in issues that no longer appear in the RB getting attached to new version, as long as they share the same status as defined for the "Done" column.
To reproduce:
1. Create new issue.
2. Drag to Done column (mapped to "Resolved" status)
3. hit the Release button --> enter details of new version and click Close.
4. note release form closes, Done column clears.
5. Hit Release button again.
Expected result: notification should show there's nothing to release.
Actual result: Release form loads up, selecting same issue that has been released in previous steps. Creating new version will create new version and attach issue created above to this new version, in addition to previous.
Note problem does not appear once released issues are moved to Closed status.
fields.summary: Release button in work mode does not respect work mode sub filter for Kanban

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: We have several columns on our rapid board and while the Story (parent) ticket types wrap, the subtasks do not, making it impossible to tell what they are. I recommend either make wrapping the default or a configuration setting. Also, I would prefer to see the entire Story ticket summary as well, and it looks like that gets unnecessarily truncated.
fields.summary: As a Rapid Board user, I need the subtask summaries to wrap so I can see what the subtask is

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Greenhopper Rapid View Wallboard Gadget doesn't show custom icons.
On Jira issues and Greenhopper cards (including Rapid Board) the custom icon appears.

The actual location of the image is:

* http://cinchcast.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/01/bug.jpeg

However, as used in the Greenhopper Rapid View Dashboard Gadget, the image URL contains unexpected text which breaks the retrieval of the resource. 

The URL that the Rapid View Wallboard Gadget is using is:

* https://pa.jira-dev.comhttp//cinchcast.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/01/bug.jpeg

Note the addition of "https://pa.jira-dev.com" at the beginning of the URL, and the fact that the colon after the following http is getting removed by a parser somewhere.

Attached are screenshots showing the issue, and showing that the custom icon is working fine in other locations.
fields.summary: Custom Icons do not show up on Rapid View Wallboard Gadget

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
- Should handle change of Story Points value


https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/GHDEV/Estimation+and+Tracking+in+the+Rapid+Board#EstimationandTrackingintheRapidBoard-Tracking
- The graph begins at the start time of the Sprint, it logically ends on the specified end date of the Sprint (which is marked on the graph) but continues until the time the Sprint was actually closed
- Allow the Sprint to be specified but default to currently active Sprint 
- The start value of the graph does not compensate for changes after the start of the sprint to the value 
- Items burn down as they reach the done column 
- Items that are added to the Sprint after its beginning are shown as scope change 
- Items that are removed from the Sprint after its beginning are shown as scope change 
- Items that have their estimate changed after the beginning of the Sprint are shown as scope change 
- Scope changes (i.e anything other than a burndown) are shown with some sort of visual signal and information on hovering the inflection point
fields.summary: MVR: Make the burndown chart understand when an issue was added/removed from Sprint (i.e understand scope change)

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
This is a complex one, so let's break it down.

* Providing an issue operation for an Issue to be able to "go to" a Rapid Board for this issue.
* The boards available to go to will be calculated only once the user initiates the action.
* Valid boards are calculated based on which boards the user has permission to see, as well as if the issue matches the filter of the board;
** In the case of Kanban boards, the issue must also match the Work mode sub filter. It should *not* match if the issue only appears on Report mode.
** In the case of Scrum boards, the issue may appear in any mode (Plan, Work or Report).
* If there are no valid boards, the user will be shown a message;
** _Optionally, the user will be prompted to create a new board based on the project of the issue_.
* If there are multiple valid boards, the user will be prompted to choose one.
* If there is only one valid board, or if the user has chosen a board, the user will be redirected instantly.
* The user will be redirected to the precise location of the issue on the chosen board.
** The issue will be selected if the location is Plan or Work mode.
** In the case of a Scrum board, if the location is the Report mode, and the issue belongs to more than one sprint, the most recent sprint's retrospective report will be chosen.
fields.summary: MVR: Issue operation to jump to a rapid board from an Issue

fields.description:
The documentation at the following locations indicates that the configuration of GreenHopper can be used to allow either the 'Resolve Issue' or 'Schedule Issue' permission to be used to control ranking. This isn't the case any more, the schedule issue permission is now required. Could we please update this? 

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Specifying+your+General+Configuration
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Ranking+an+Issue
fields.summary: Documentation refers to 'Resolve Issue' being usable as a ranking permission, this isn't the case any more

This is similar to the request to be able to create swimlanes based upon all the possible values for a field (GHS-4669)

fields.summary: Links from configuration page and manage page to a given board should use stored settings.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Phase 1. Allow for a 'useStoredSettings' flag, which sets the rapid view from the URL, but then pulls all other settings from local storage.

Phase 2. Allow for selective inclusion of some fields, but overriding the rest with local storage (instead of defaults). This is to allow for the case where something links to a work mode for a given view, selects a specific issue, but doesn't override other settings.
fields.summary: As a 3rd party developer, I would like to be able to link to a GH board and specify some settings (but have the other settings come from storage, rather than defaults)

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
See http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GHKB/Ability+to+Sort+Resolved+or+Closed+Issues.

The default JIRA workflow makes closed/resolved issues uneditable. This is a historical thing with JIRA; before GH, it made sense. One way to achieve this would be change the default workflow (or go through the workaround), but perhaps GreenHopper could ignore this JIRA setting.
fields.summary: Ability to sort closed or resolved issues

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
To replicate:

Setup a blank instance, add a new project, GreenHopper and a new custom field, only add it to Epic type issues and add it to all screens.

Go to the rapid board, choose create and start with the issue type Bug, you won't see the field you just created. If you switch to Epic, it still won't appear. Vice versa if you start with Epic, that field will still appear even after switching back to Bug.

Tested against 5.8.7, but not an issue in GH 5.9, so upgrading to JIRA 5.0 + GH 5.9 fixes this issue.
fields.summary: Quick Create Dialog on Rapid Board does change fields when changing issue type

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
We had a major problem with sorting issues in GreenHopper after update to Jira 5.0
If I swap two issues on any page, one of it will appear on a first page! 

Our backlog become a complete mess before we realized whats wrong.
Reindexing issues solved the problem, why it didn't happen automatically if its so important?

Becauase of this we have to sort entire backlog.
fields.summary: Issue sorting bug

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
*Brief*
As a scrum master, I have the task of putting together the next sprint. As we have so many stories to choose from, I need a way for myself and the product owner to sit down and see all these stories in one place and organise some kind of priority that can then help me put a sprint together.

I currently use a physical card wall for this task where I have all the story cards posted, grouped by the next couple of sprints then the rest as a backlog underneath. the cards are also grouped by component from left to right on the wall.

I would rather use GreenHopper to help me achieve, we already use it for tracking the current sprint quite successfully but find it difficult to prioritise the backlog by just looking at one long list or one version or component at a time. 

I have created a mock of what I think the card wall view in greenhopper could look like. Please find attached two PDF's one with and the other without comments

*Conditions of satisfaction*
* the issues are laid out in a grid view as cards, similar to the way sub tasks on the task board
* the cards should display in rank order with the highest priority listed at the top
* you can drag stories up and down to change its rank, highest is most priority similar to regular planning board view

* the cards should be grouped by version
* versions are displayed in date order with the earliest version listed highest and the latest at the bottom along with an unscheduled group.
* i can choose how many issues i see on a page, per version and column before it paginates
* I can hide versions I don't want to deal with. We use versions for tracking sprints and releases and I am only interested in organising new sprints so want to hide the release versions

* I can see how many story points are currently in a version
* I can set a limit on how many story points should be in each version which would be the team's velocity
* If a version has too many story points in it then it should clearly indicate this so issues can be manually moved

* you can drag stories between versions and it automatically adjusts the fixVersion
* when the fix version is updated, it only removes the previous version and adds the new one, leaving any onther versions that story was part of, still there.

* It should be possible to arrange the issues into columns
* I can choose to arrange the columns by Component, assignee or just one big column
* I can reorder the columns to put the most important components or assignees first, furthest left, and the least important further right

* I can choose to center the view around story points or ideal hours when dealing with velocity, I personally would use story points
* the story point value or ideal hours of each card is clearly visible
* I can quickly set the team's velocity in bulk for all future versions so I can get an idea if more or less issues can be added to future versions

* there should be a minimum width of each column so that the issues remain readable, and a horizontal scrollbar should allow you have more columns than can fit on the screen at the same time
* the version should remain on the screen when scrolling horizontally so you never forget which versions your looking at
fields.summary: As a Scrum Master, I can switch to a Card Wall view on the planning board where I can prioritise backlog stories and schedule them in future sprints

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Attempting to change the assignee of an issue at the bottom of a list of issues in the Planning Board will make the window scroll back to the top of the list.
h4. Steps to reproduce:
# Make sure to add the assignee field for the List View.
# Have a least 20 issues in a particular sprint.
# Go to the bottom of the list of issues; you'll be focusing on the last issue for this to work.
# Click on the Assignee field so that a list of assignable users are populated.
# Select a user from the list.
# The window would scroll up to the top of the list.

(i) The above steps can be reproduced for the Card View as well.

This issue persists across all browsers.
fields.summary: Amending the Assignee Field on any Issues at the Bottom List in the Planning Board will Scroll the Window to the Top of the List

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
A customer on OnDemand has problems viewing Rapid Boards they create, getting instead an "Internal Server Error" message. Log reveals there's an exception raised in {{Jira44StatusCreationService}} ([full stack trace|https://paste.atlassian.com/view/6441]).

The support case is [JST-33546|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JST-33546]. Appears to be related to the customer's data as not reproducible on a fresh OnDemand instance but is reproducible after importing the customer's data. Also appears to be OnDemand specific (judging by Maleko's comments on the ticket).
fields.summary: Error creating extant status from Jira44StatusCreationService (in JIRA 5)

fields.description:
As mentioned in the [docs|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Releasing+a+Version], Project Administrator permission is required. This is not great from a security perspective as anyone that can release could mess up (unintentionally) all the project config.

| You will need to have the JIRA 'Project Administrator'

We should be able to use the Permission Schemes to assign specific groups the role to create release versions and release via Rapid Board.
fields.summary: Allow non project admin users to release from Rapid Board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: With the introduction of Global Rank it is now possible to rank issues on the Rapid Board.  Unfortunately if I am viewing issues outside of the Rapid Board there is no way to change the rank.  The only other place in JIRA where we can see the relative position of issues is the Issue Navigator, so this would be the natural place to put this functionality.  Ranking issues often requires seeing more information than is available in a single view on the Rapid Board so, again, the Issue Navigator seems like a good place for this functionality.
fields.summary: As a GH user I would like to be able to change the Global Rank of an issue from the Issue Navigator

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: Javascript error: Object [object Object] has no method 'addClassName'

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When you set the Dashboard gadgets to 'Auto' they will show the sprint (version) with the latest release date. Even if that is a sprint in the future. 

About a day or two before sprint planning I (and probably most people) come in and start planning the next sprint (adding versions, etc). 

The 'Auto' feature would more naturally select the version with the latest release date that is *NOT* started in the future. This would be much more expected behavior for "Auto". And it would release the planners from having to work around the problem by not setting the release date until the morning of the sprint start. uggggg
fields.summary: Dashboard gadgets using 'Auto' to pick the current sprint pick future sprints, not logical behavior

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Currently, any user that can log into JIRA can create a rapid view, and potentially can share it with anyone else if they base it off an existing shared filter.

Ideally we should let them either:

1. Create a rapid view with non-shared filters only

Or

2. Not let them create rapid views if they don't have the above permission.

Even better would be a GH specific permission governing this, but I understand this is not trivial.

Currently, a User A could create a shared filter that everyone can see, then user B without share permissions could create 100+ rapid views based on this filter, that will be shared with everyone and clog up the list of rapid views for everyone.
fields.summary: Rapid View creation should respect create shared objects permission

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: On Rapid Board it seems that issue key gets a strikethrough if there is a resolution on the issue,at least if it is "fixed". However that may be misleading when the issue isn't resolved/closed. There are many reasons why there may be a resolution on cases that has not ended, so there should at least be a possibility to remove this feature on request.
fields.summary: Misleading strikethrough in RapidBoard

fields.description:
Because the field edit is triggered while the browser follows the link. As a result the ajax request for field editing fails.

Expected behaviour: mouse clicks on links inside value (e.g. description) should not start inline editing.
fields.summary: Clicking on a link in a detail view field shows error

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Quick filters in Rapid board should be possible to configure with three states
- Positive (green) 
- Negative (red)
- Passive (none)

Some types of filters may be relevant for both positive and negative filtering. It would be useful to have the possibility to use the same button for both, instead of having several buttons. 
An example: 
Button name: Epic
Positive: issuetype = Epic
Negative: issuetype != Epic

This will make it easier to find a suitable combination of different filters for many occasions. It will also help save space since the alternative today is having both "Show Epic" and "Hide Epic"

Having coloured background on the buttons will also visualize the active filters even more. Today it is easy to see that it is an active filter when focused on, but when focus is further down the page it may be easily overlooked.
fields.summary: Feature request - Rapid Board: Three state quick filters
